Comment: Military service is an obligation. The country cannot function, under any administration, without a fully staffed, functioning and capable armed forces. Donald Trump needs a military every bit as much as Bill Clinton did. In fact, we never should have ended the draft. The Army coming up short on recruiting is a national black eye. That 76% of men 18-26 are unfit for military service is a national disgrace. With a draft, taxpayers wouldn’t be paying new enlisteds $28k plus quarters, subsistence, training, transportation and other allowances.

Author: IDontKnowTBH1

Comment: And what, pray tell, is the job that “needs to be done”? We aren’t(or at least we *shouldn’t* be) some militaristic warmongering state where the only purpose that men serve is to “protect the people by any means necessary, even at the expense of their lives.” Even if 76% of 18-26 year old men are “unfit for service”, I feel more comfortable with the 24% who are that volunteer their services rather than the idea of forcing people to BE comfortable with it. For that matter, this whole conversation seems centered on the idea that it’s the male responsibility to do all this, yet I would feel equally comfortable with ANY person, be they man, woman, or WHATEVER gender identity, who WANTS to enlist.  All I’m saying is if a majority of that 76% are people like me(and I’m too old to be drafted anyway), you are going to have a LOT of conscientious observers that end up costing more money than it would to put aside this ridiculous fear that women and transgender individuals are incapable of serving in the military.

Comment: Every job that is created needs to be done by someone. That’s essential to capitalism. Where these are poorly paid or in poor conditions then mature, self-disciplined men need to step up and do them. In effect, one and a half million people need to work at Walmart, another two million at Amazon and so on without regard to pay and treatment. As I was taught by a recruiter many years ago, a portion of the population, and I include myself in this group, needs to understand that what we think, believe, want or feel doesn’t matter. Those are just distractions and emotions that can be ignored if you have enough discipline.
